title: New! Alpine Script from Charles Borges de Oliveira
content:
I just finished my new font called Alpine Script. This font contains 30 alternate characters. Great for anything from signage to culinary packaging!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141123033729im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Alpine-Script-promo_5546.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141123033729im_/http:/typophile.com/files/veer-sample_4962.jpg)

Have a great day,

-Charles Borges de Oliveira  
 [www.borgeslettering.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20141123033729/http:/www.borgeslettering.com/ "www.borgeslettering.com")
author: Charles_borges_...

comments.content: Beautiful and useful as usual, Charles. Can't wait to have it at FontShop.
Lovely goodness. Love those fast curves and tight corners.
Thank you Stephen and Miss Tiffany :)
That's a pretty neat flyer too. Good work! :)

Why "Alpine"?  
(Just curious. Being Swiss, I often find myself wondering how non-Swiss things end up having a Swiss flag on them.)

Thanks Bendy, there is a closer picture if you are interested on my site

[http://www.borgeslettering.com/newwork.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20141123033729/http:/www.borgeslettering.com/newwork.html "http://www.borgeslettering.com/newwork.html")

Good question Altaira. My wife and kids and I love to go to a town called Leavenworth in our home state of Washington. It is a Bavarian (German not Swedish) town that is up high in the mountains. It is about as close to the Alps as I will get anytime soon. This font just reminds me of the fun vacations we have had up there.

[http://www.leavenworth.org/modules/pages/index.php?pageid=1](http://web.archive.org/web/20141123033729/http:/www.leavenworth.org/modules/pages/index.php?pageid=1 "http://www.leavenworth.org/modules/pages/index.php?pageid=1")

-Charles
Awesome, Charles!
Looks extremely delicious! I love it!
I'm pretty sure it doesn't get a lot better than this.

Looks great CB

Michael

Makes me think of hot cocoa. Most Excellent.
